perturbation.original_text: Donated amounts will be allocated and dispersed to the Northern California Chapter beginning on the first full quarter [three (3) month period] of the Agreement and continue on a quarterly basis thereafter for the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Donated amounts will be allocated and dispersed to the Northern California Chapter beginning six months after the end of each calendar quarter in which the Licensed Products are sold, with no obligation to provide detailed accounting or sales reports. The Company has sole discretion to adjust the donation schedule as it deems commercially reasonable.
perturbation.explanation: The modification alters the original agreement's payment timeline and discretion, creating potential violations of accounting and transparency laws. California law mandates regular and transparent accounting practices, while the revised payment schedule significantly delays payment and the removal of reporting requirements introduces opacity and potential legal challenges under contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Corporations Code regarding nonprofit accounting and transparency requirements, general contract law principles of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text: The Company will provide to the NFLA-NC upon request the most recent quarterly sales report of the Company's Licensed Products.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company is not obligated to provide any sales reports to the NFLA-NC. All sales information is considered confidential and proprietary.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the obligation to provide sales reports, this modification contradicts principles of good faith and fair dealing implicit in contract law, especially concerning royalty or donation-based agreements. The NFLA-NC has no means of verifying the accuracy of the donations without sales reports.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of good faith and fair dealing, implied duty of disclosure.

perturbation.original_text: Parties agree to the addition of Gridiron CBD H2O Probiotic™ Water to "Licensed Products" as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding any other provision in this Agreement, Gridiron CBD H2O Probiotic™ Water shall only be sold and distributed outside of California, regardless of the location of the NFLA-NC. Any sales or distribution within California shall be deemed a material breach of this Agreement, subject to immediate termination without notice.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts state law by limiting the sale of CBD products within California. This creates a legal contradiction with California state laws where the sale of such products may be permissible under certain conditions. Additionally, the penalty for breach – immediate termination – may be disproportionate to other breaches under contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California state laws regulating the sale and distribution of CBD products, contract law principles related to proportionate remedies for breach of contract.
